definition.title: Group homomorphism
definition.statement:
Let G,H be groups.
A map \phi\colon G\to H is called a homomorphism if \phi(xy) = \phi(x)\phi(y) for all x,y in G.

statement.p:
Show that each of the following are homomorphisms.
GL(n,\R)\to \R^\ast given by M\to \det M
\Z\to \Z given by x\to mx, some fixed m\in \Z
G\to G, G any group, given by x\to axa^{-1}, some fixed a\in G
\C^\ast\to\C^\ast given by z\to z^2
Show that each of the following are not homomorphisms. In each case, demonstrate what fails.
\Z\to \Z given by x\to x+3
\Z\to \Z given by x\to x^2
D_4\to D_4 given by g\to g^2

Let \phi\colon G\to H be a group homomorphism, and let e_H be the identity element for H. We write \ker(\phi) to denote the set \ker(\phi) :=\phi^{-1}(e_H) = \{g\in G\colon \phi(g)=e_H\}, called the kernel of \phi.

Find the kernel of each of the following homomorphisms.
GL(n,\R)\to \R^\ast given by M\to \det M
\Z_n\to \Z_n (some integer n\geq 1) given by x\to mx \pmod{n}, some fixed m\in \Z
G\to G, G any group, given by x\to axa^{-1}, some fixed a\in G

Let \phi\colon G\to H be a homomorphism of groups. Let e_G,e_H denote the identity elements of G,H, respectively. We have the following.
(identity goes to identity) \phi(e_G) = e_H
(inverses go to inverses) \phi\left(g^{-1}\right) = \left(\phi(g)\right)^{-1} for all g\in G
\ker(\phi) is a subgroup of G
\phi(G) is a subgroup of H
(preimage sets are cosets of the kernel) \phi(x)=y if and only if \phi^{-1}(y) = x\ker(\phi)
\phi(x)=\phi(y) if and only if x\ker(\phi)=y\ker(\phi)
\phi is one-to-one if and only if \ker(\phi)=\{e_G\}

proposition.title: G/K is a group if and only if K is a kernel

statement.p: Let K be a subgroup of a group G. The set G/K of cosets of K forms a group under the operation (xK)(yK) = xyK if and only if K is the kernel of a homomorphism G\to G' for some group G'.
An isomorphism of groups is a homomorphism that is both one-to-one and onto. If \phi\colon G\to H is an isomorphism, we say that G is isomorphic to H.

notation.description: H is a normal subgroup of G

statement.p: A subgroup H of a group G is called normal if ghg^{-1}\in H for every g\in G, h\in H. We write H\trianglelefteq G to indicate that H is a normal subgroup of G.

Let K be a subgroup of a group G. The following are equivalent.
K is the kernel of some group homomorphism \phi\colon G\to H
G/K is a group with multiplication given by
K is a normal subgroup of G

exercisegroup.title: Automorphisms
exercisegroup.introduction: Let G be a group. An automorphism of G is an isomorphism from G to itself. The set of all automorphisms of G is denoted \Aut(G).

statement.p: Let g be an element of a group G. Show that the map C_g\colon \to G is an automorphism of G.
Show that \Aut(G) is a group under the operation of function composition.
Show that \Inn(G) := \{C_g\colon g\in G\} is a subgroup of \Aut(G). (The group \Inn(G) is called the group of inner automorphisms of G.)
Find an example of an automorphism of a group that is not an inner automorphism.
